text: I spend excessive time perfecting details that others might not notice instead of moving forward efficiently.
I struggle to complete tasks because I keep finding ways to improve them instead of accepting good enough.
I feel anxious when my work doesn't meet my own high standards instead of feeling satisfied with progress.
I delay starting projects because I want everything to be perfect from the beginning instead of beginning with a draft.
I criticize my own work harshly even when others praise it instead of accepting positive feedback.
I redo tasks multiple times to achieve perfection instead of moving on after acceptable quality.
I avoid sharing my work until it's flawless instead of seeking feedback early in the process.
I set unrealistic standards for myself that are difficult to achieve instead of setting achievable goals.
I feel like a failure when I make mistakes instead of viewing errors as learning opportunities.
I compare my work to the best examples I can find instead of comparing it to my own previous efforts.
I spend more time planning than executing because I want the perfect approach instead of starting and adapting.
I feel stressed when I can't control every aspect of a project instead of accepting some uncertainty.
I struggle to delegate because I believe only I can do things perfectly instead of trusting others.
I focus on minor flaws that others don't notice instead of appreciating the overall quality of my work.
I procrastinate on important tasks because I'm waiting for the perfect conditions instead of starting with what I have.
I feel dissatisfied with completed projects because they could always be better instead of celebrating achievements.
I avoid trying new things because I might not excel immediately instead of embracing the learning process.
I spend excessive time on formatting and presentation instead of focusing on content quality.
I feel like I'm never doing enough even when I've accomplished a lot instead of recognizing my efforts.
I believe that anything less than perfect is unacceptable instead of valuing progress and improvement.
